source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_000<tab>Good morrow to you, my <var 08 E905 ((lady)) ((lord)) /var>. I am the nezumi doshin, a member of a Far Eastern delegation come to share our traditions of Heavensturn with the good people of Eorzea. If there is aught you would know of this year's celebration, you need only ask.
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_000あっしは、東方より参じた使節団の者でやす。
わからねえことがありやしたら、どうぞなんなりと。

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_001<tab>At the turning of the year, a small delegation journeys to Eorzea to herald the coming of Heavensturn and share our traditions. In so doing, we aim to strengthen the bonds of friendship between Eorzea and the Far East.
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_001へえ、あっしらは、「降神祭」の季節の到来にあたり、
エオルゼアとの親睦を深めるため、
東方より派遣された使節団でやす。

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_002<tab>To mark this occasion, our leader, the nezumi bugyo, has had the uniquely brilliant idea of distributing advent cakes to the people of Limsa Lominsa. Please do try some─they're delicious, and entirely safe to eat!
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_002あっしらの親分「子奉行」さまとともに、
「降神餅」の配布を始めとした催しを企画しておりやす。
どうかご期待くだせえ！

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_010<tab>Why, we are here to celebrate this most auspicious of Heavensturns, of course! And with far less danger to life and limb, now that we have secured the assistance of helping hands like yours in putting down the mochi.
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_010へえ、冒険者さまが「降神餅」を切り分けてくれたおかげで、
つつがなく「降神祭」は進んでおりやす。

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_011<tab>We will be needing quite a few more advent cakes, of course, and seem to have no shortage of ominously undulating mochi, so your continued aid would be more than welcome!
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_011お祭り期間中は、引き続き「降神餅」の配布を続ける予定ですので、
もし気が向きましたら、また餅の切り分けをお願いいたしやす！

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_030<tab>At the turning of the year, a small delegation of our people will journey to Eorzea to herald the coming of Heavensturn, and in so doing, strengthen the bonds of friendship between Eorzea and the Far East.
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_030へえ、あっしらは、「降神祭」の季節の到来にあたり、
エオルゼアとの親睦を深めるため、
東方より派遣された使節団でやす。

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_031<tab>To mark the occasion, our leader, the nezumi bugyo, has had the uniquely brilliant idea of distributing advent cakes to the people of Limsa Lominsa. Please do try some─they're delicious, and entirely safe to eat!
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_031リムサ・ロミンサにて、あっしらの親分「子奉行」さまが、
「降神餅」の配布を始めとした催しを企画しておりやす。
よければ、足を伸ばしてみてくだせえ。

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_040<tab>You are unfamiliar with this festival? The tradition has a rich history which dates back centuries, but I do not wish to bore you, so I shall try and keep my summation brief.
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_040おや、ご存じではないので？
東方の住人であるあっしがお教えするのも、
なんだかおかしな話でやすが……。

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_041<tab>Heavensturn is a celebration that marks the start of a new year, though the way in which this day is observed differs from region to region. Here in Eorzea, it is said the Twelve select one among them to keep vigil over the realm until the next passing of the twelve moons. I believe this year it is Byregot, the Builder, who has been charged with this duty.
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_041「降神祭」とは、新たな季節の巡りの開幕を祝う聖なる祭典。
この地では、十二神の中から新たな主神を選ぶそうで、
今回は、建築と工芸を司る工神「ビエルゴ」様が選ばれたとか。

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_042<tab>In the Far East, however, the changing of the year is heralded by one of twelve totem animals. As you have no doubt discerned from my helm, this year we pay homage to the nezumi, harbinger of fortune.
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_042さて一方、東方では、神話より選ばれたる12種の動物から、
新たな季節を司るものを選ぶのが習わしでして、
今回は「子（ね）」が選ばれやした。

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_043<tab>Ah, but I forget where I am. I believe you Eorzeans call the selfsame creatures “mice.” Or is it “rats”? ...Frankly, I am unsure what the difference is meant to be. Just envision a small rodent.
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_043聞き慣れぬ名かと存じやすが、なんてことはありやせん。
エオルゼアでは「ネズミ」と呼ばれる動物のことでやす。
これも東方の文化のひとつと、お含みおきくだせえ。

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_050<tab>It is how we create our advent cakes, the staple sweet of Heavensturn in the Far East. We first prepare a sizable portion of steamed rice and place it in a mortar, where it is then pounded into the thick, sticky paste we call mochi.
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_050「餅つき」は東方の縁起物「降神餅」をこしらえる料理法。
ホカホカに炊き上げた米を、大きな臼に入れ、
杵でこねれば、白く柔らかな「餅」の一丁できあがりでやす。

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_051<tab>Though you may find it hard to believe, the pounding of the rice in and of itself is something of a spectacle─particularly this year, I'm given to understand.
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_051とはいえ、実際に見ていただくのが、手っ取り早いってなもんで。
「餅代官」がその「降神餅」を用意しておりやすので、
興味がおありでしたら、ご覧になってはいかがでやしょう？

source: TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_052<tab>If you wish to see for yourself, you need only make the short journey to middle La Noscea. You will find the mochi daikan near the Zephyr Drift. Happy pummeling!
target:
TEXT_FESNYR2020_00537_MOUSESERVER_000_052「餅つき」は、中央ラノシアのゼファードリフト付近で、
やっておりやす。
